quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Milli Vanilli and James
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, singles, milli. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Why is April 2, 1998, a significant date for Milli Vaniili fans?

options.text: Fabian Morvan released his first solo album, titled This Time You Know Its True!
Rob Pilatus was found dead in a Frankfurt, Germany hotel room.
Rob Pilatus is cleared of assault charges he was accused of in 1997.
This is the date that the group released their comeback album titled Read Our Lips - Were Really Singing!

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rob Pilatus was found dead in a Frankfurt, Germany hotel room.

questions.question: Rapper Charles Shaw revealed the truth regarding Milli Vanillis lip syncing antics  to a reporter.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: The Rick James-parodying sketch on the sketch comedy television program, Chappelles Show, was a retrospective of the actual love-and-hate friendship between James and Charlie Murphy.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: How many hit singles were spun off the Milli Vanilli album, Girl, You Know Its True following its US release?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Four

questions.question: On February 22, 1990, Milli Vanilli won a Grammy in which category?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Best New Artist

questions.question: Which popular US comedian, compared a then new US television series to Milli Vanilli by saying : The show is a mixture of crime and music... kind of like Milli Vanilli!
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jay Leno

questions.question: What significant event, regarding Milli Vanilli, occured on November 15, 1990?

options.text: Milli Vanilli signed a contract with Arista Records to produce 3 more albums, on the strength of their recent Grammy win.
Producer Frank Farian revealed to the media the truth about Milli Vanilli- that their voices were dubbed by other artists.
Fabrice Morvan was arrested on assault charges in Los Angeles.
Milli Vanilli released an album in which they actually sung their own vocals.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Producer Frank Farian revealed to the media the truth about Milli Vanilli- that their voices were dubbed by other artists.

questions.question: Who is the producer credited with putting Milli Vanilli on the road to fame and fortune?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Frank Farian

questions.question: In 1993, Milli Vanilli released their self-titled Rob and Fab album.  How many copies of this album were pressed and sent to market?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Less than 3,000

questions.question: At the time of his death, James was working on an autobiography, called this.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Confessions Of A Superfreak

questions.question: What are the names of the singers who comprised the dynamic duo of Milli Vanilli?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rob Pilatus and Fabrice Morvan

questions.question: What date was rapper Bow Wow born on?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: March 9, 1987

questions.question: What is Bow Wows full name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Shad Gregory Moss

questions.question: Finish the popular catch phrase from the sketch about Rick James.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: ..., bitch!

questions.question: Rob Pilatus of Milli Vanilli was widely ridiculed in the Press, after comparing himself to which of the following artists?

options.text: Elvis Costello, Luther Vandross, Peabo Bryson, and Ray Charles
Paul McCartney, Elvis Presley, Mick Jagger, Paul Simon and Bob Dylan
Michael Jackson, Boy George ODowd, Barry White and Murray Head
Joe Jackson, Leonard Cohen, Eminem, Bill Withers, and Big Bird

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Paul McCartney, Elvis Presley, Mick Jagger, Paul Simon and Bob Dylan

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Canada and Band
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, female, canada. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which of the following Canadian bands of the early 70s failed to crack the US top 10?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jericho

questions.question: Some bands are considered Canadian bands in Canada because they spent time in Canada or had a Canadian member, although they arent considered Canadian bands outside of Canada. Which of the following bands is NOT considered a Canadian band under these terms?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Poco

questions.question: When Bow Wow was only six years old, he was Snoop Doggs opening act at many of his concerts.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Which of these 1970s horn bands had a Canadian lead singer, who was once deported from the US for working illegally (as a singer)?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Blood, Sweat and Tears

questions.question: This band, formed in 1968, had many hits in Canada before finally hitting the US charts in 1982?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rush

questions.question: Until early 2006 Bow Wow dated which popular female RB singer?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ciara

questions.question: This group was formed when Canadian band Brave Belt reformed and had considered themselves a hard rock metal band. Their hits included Takin Care of Business, Let it Ride and You Aint Seen Nothing Yet.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bachman-Turner Overdrive

questions.question: What Toronto band had hits in the US with One Fine Morning and Sunny Days.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lighthouse

questions.question: Rapper Snoop Dogg discovered Bow Wow, gave him his nickname and granted him a place in what record company?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Death Row Records

questions.question: What Canadian band had a top ten hit in the US in 1971 with the sappy sweet love long Stay Awhile?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Bells

questions.question: The Irish Rovers, who had a top ten hit in 1968 with The Unicorn were a Canadian band.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: This was the first Canadian Band to make it big in the US, and their string of hits, including These Eyes, Share the Land and American Woman remains unequaled.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Guess Who

questions.question: This family band from southern Ontario had a monster hit with Heartbeat, its a Lovebeat.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The DeFranco Family

questions.question: Bow Wow co-starred with Tyrese Gibson in the 2006 action drama Waist Deep .
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Bow Wow and his stepsister Erica were raised by his mother and her husband. What are Bow Wows mothers and stepfathers names?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Teresa Caldwell and Rodney Caldwell
